## Overview



Let's have a look at the `{spatstat}` package for spatial point patterns usage: 
```{r}
#| eval: false
install.packages("spatstat")
```

Load necessary libraries:
```{r}
#| message: false
#| warning: false
library(tidyverse)
library(spatstat)
```


For this challenge we have a look at the `bovine tubercolosis` dataset from the {spatstat} package.

Geospatial data of 873 farm locations with detected bovine tuberculosis in Cornwall, UK, over the years 1989-2002. 

    ?btb
    
```{r}
spatstat.data::btb
```

```{r}
spatstat.data::btb.extra
```


```{r}
data(btb)
```

```{r}
summary(btb)
```
```{r}
btb$marks
dat <- tibble(lon=btb$x,
       lat=btb$y,
       n=btb$n)
```


```{r}
dat%>%
  ggplot(aes(x=lon,y=lat))+
  geom_point()
```
